<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->
Searched for `ROOK_CURRENT_NAMESPACE_ONLY` with no results

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report
Rook operator fails to update cluster to v1.0.2 from v0.9.3 when ceph cluster is deployed to `rook-ceph` namespace when using the chart yamls.

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
rook-ceph-mgr/mon/ods deployments left alone.

**Expected behavior:**
rook-ceph-mgr/mon/ods deployments upgraded rook image from v0.9.3 to v1.0.2

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
1. Deploy v0.9.3 operator and Ceph cluster using rook-ceph-system and rook-ceph namespaces respectively using the helm chart templates at version v0.9.3. 
1. Delete the [old permissions](https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/v1.0.2/Documentation/ceph-upgrade.md#2-update-modified-permissions)
1. Redeploy the charts using the manifests from v1.0.2 version of the charts.

**Note**
Easily worked around by updating the variable from 
https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/ecca2daaedd8982e87abef17acd57e76e049a1ec/cluster/charts/rook-ceph/templates/deployment.yaml#L30-L31

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
```
NAME="Amazon Linux"
VERSION="2"
ID="amzn"
ID_LIKE="centos rhel fedora"
VERSION_ID="2"
PRETTY_NAME="Amazon Linux 2"
ANSI_COLOR="0;33"
CPE_NAME="cpe:2.3:o:amazon:amazon_linux:2"
HOME_URL="https://amazonlinux.com/"
```
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): `Linux ip-192-168-6-128.eu-west-2.compute.internal 4.14.106-97.85.amzn2.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Mar 15 17:07:54 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
`
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: `eks`
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): `rook: v1.0.2`
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12+", GitVersion:"v1.12.6-eks-d69f1b", GitCommit:"d69f1bf3669bf00b7f4a758e978e0e7a1e3a68f7", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-02-28T20:26:10Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.8", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): `EKS`
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):
```
  cluster:
    id:     0798b0ac-18b1-47bf-a887-b24ac20e18a0
    health: HEALTH_OK

  services:
    mon: 3 daemons, quorum a,b,c
    mgr: a(active)
    osd: 5 osds: 5 up, 5 in

  data:
    pools:   1 pools, 100 pgs
    objects: 429  objects, 1.3 GiB
    usage:   8.4 GiB used, 5.0 TiB / 5.0 TiB avail
    pgs:     100 active+clean

  io:
    client:   11 KiB/s wr, 0 op/s rd, 1 op/s wr
```
title: No upgrade of rook-ceph cluster from v0.9.3 to v1.0.x in rook-ceph namespace
